intro: Androsaemum xylosteifolium, commonly known as the woolly androsaemum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
